intro: Pteropogon australis, commonly known as the southern pteropogon, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly referred to as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale blue or purple flowers. Pteropogon australis is often found in open, sandy or rocky habitats and is adapted to the dry, temperate climate of its native region.
